intro: Boechera perstellata, commonly known as the Sierra Point Peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a low, spreading growth habit and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
